description: Founded in 1972, the NWLC works primarily for the rights of working and low-income women on cases surrounding such issues as pay and sexual assult. The NWLC says on its website, “We champion policies and laws that help women and girls achieve their potential at every stage of their lives—at school, at work, at home, and in retirement.”
headquarters_location: 11 Dupont Circle NW, Suite 800, Washington, DC 20036

description: In many parts of the world, women go through prolonged childbirth without adequate care. As a result, many women develop a fistula, leaving them incontinent, and often resulting rejection from society, their families, and even their husbands. The Fistula Foundation works to prevent fistula, and provices corrective surgery to those women who are effected.
headquarters_location: 1922 The Alameda, Suite. 302, San Jose, CA 95126

description: Founded in 1993, Camfed works to alleviate poverty by educating young girls, enabling them to become future leaders in their societies. Camfed works with more than 6,000 schools throughout Africa to support girls, primarily in poorly served rural areas.
headquarters_location: 466 Geary Street, Suite 400, San Francisco, CA 94102 United States

description: Dress for Success Worldwide tackles the barriers standing between women and economic success by providing appropriate clothing, skill development, help in job search, and tools for staying relevant in today’s business world. There are numerous ways to get involved with this inspiring charity, from donating money or professional clothing, to volunteering, to setting up an affiliate in your city.
headquarters_location: 32 East 31st Street New York, New York 10016 United States

description: Futures Without Violence, addresses some of the most high-profile issues today. From violence in the workplace to human trafficking, to bullying, to domestic violence. The organization collects data, provides resources for all including Congress and the White House, works on awareness campaigns, and reaches out to partners of all kinds in communities.
headquarters_location: 100 Montgomery Street, The Presidio, San Francisco, CA 94129

description: Girls Not Brides brings together some 1300 organizations from 100 countries across the globe to fight the practice of child marriage. You can choose among numerous projects ranging from bikes for girls in Nepal to empowering girls through sports in Afganistan. Whatever project you choose, rest assured that you’ve contributed to ending this hideous practice.
headquarters_location: Seventh Floor, 65 Leadenhall Street, London EC3A 2AD United Kingdom

description: HKI programs combat hunger, cataract, trachoma, onchocerciasis (river blindness) and refractive error. With programs in 21 African and Asian countries plus the United States, HKI aims to reduce the suffering of people who have little access to health care because of poverty.
headquarters_location: 1 Dag Hammarskjold Plaza, Floor 2, New York, NY 10017 United States

description: Founded in 2005, Kiva specializes in giving loans to people, who pay those loans back. This is not a traditional charity. It is empowerment. More than one billion dollars have been lent in this way since Kiva started. Kiva is not just for women, but 81 percent of its beneficiaries are women, often entrepreneurs who found small businesses that help them, their families and their communities.
headquarters_location: 986 Mission Street, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103 USA

description: AnitaB.org envisions a future where the people who imagine and build technology mirror the people and societies for whom they build it. Our social enterprise supports women in technical fields, as well as the organizations that employ them and the academic institutions training the next generation. A full roster of programs help women grow, learn, and develop their highest potential.
